revised_title: A Detailed Account of a Water-Spout Phenomenon in Deeping-Fen, Lincolnshire
tldr: The article describes a water-spout event that occurred in Deeping-Fen, Lincolnshire in 1752. The phenomenon moved rapidly, destroying grass, straw, and stubble, and even breaking gates off their hinges. The author, Benjamin Ray, observed the event and shared his account with the Royal Society. Multiple witnesses confirmed the event, and three more similar phenomena were reported in different locations.
